review.itemreviewed: Synergy PWL SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody:
I am between a size 12 and a 12.5.  I have a super narrow and flat foot. These boots are a little big in the toe box for me; I used to wear Nike Zoom Force boots. My toes would smash the front of my boot on my size 12's, and 12.5's end up being too big. The heel lock technology keeps my heels back in these, and keeps them snug. 

But this boot is fantastic. It is lace up liner and lace up outer boot; which I've grown to like. The Boa is a heel lock feature that is 100/100 amazing. It is a mid flex boot that softens somewhat quickly after about 2-3 days, but that heel lock makes them stiffer and more responsive. It is very adjustable to the preference of your day.

Maybe the heel lock technology is old and I'm just now trying it, but it's awesome. I'll never go back. I think Nidecker has a similar tech. I'll be searching for a heel lock in hopefully a more narrow boot in the future.

I find in normal Boa boots that tighten the boot outside and liner are difficult to get in and out of for the day. These boots are suuuper easy to get in and out of once you pop open the Boa release. 

Don't go cheap! Get these boots, or at least find ones with the heel lock tech. Game is changed.
review.name: Amazing boot!

review.itemreviewed: Synergy PWL SJ BOA Snowboard Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody: I was excited for this boot and thought in theory how great it sounded.  Not sure if they're going off a different last this year as I have worn Salomon boots for the last 20 years and they have always been a dialed in fit with zero heel lift.  These boots just fit different and just feel a little sloppy.  The boa and the lacing loosen up after a run or two.  I've tried different ways of doing them up but will most likely be looking for different boots next year which is disappointing as I loved the ability to change the flex and customize them for different riding.
review.name: Wanted to love it

review.reviewBody: Perfect comfort and fit. So cozy and not too bulky. (Fyi, I wear 8.5 us ladies shoes.) Love these. After wearing a few more months to test endurance in my work and play requiring work boots, outdoors, concrete floors, etc, anticipate getting several more pairs.

review.reviewBody:
Awesome as are all your 
Products. Guiding on the Texas coast has been made comfortable fishing in the winter because of 
Simms over the top warm clothing.

review.reviewBody: These are thick and comfy.  The first time I wore them they ended up bunched in the toe box of my Muck Boots, which is why I deducted a star.  I was so disappointed in their performance that I hardly wore them after that.  I wore them today with hiking boots and they stayed in place.  I have problems with socks being too tight around the ankle - I get swelling, itching and pain.  These socks did not cause discomfort that way so at this point I am on the fence about whether I will buy more.  It is sort of a Goldilocks story - too tight on the ankle and the socks hurt, too loose and I guess they end up in the toe box.
review.name: A little too loose yet not too tight - Goldilocks

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm and fits nicely on the cold Florida days.  My feet don’t sweat.

review.reviewBody: Summit rainier with it. Amazing product, comfy, light, and with a huge capacity. Lot of room inside but also outside with many options to tie things outside. I strongly recommend this bag.
review.name: Amazing backpack

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with heavy loads, and well dialed features for mountain objectives. My preference would be to have a sleeve for an avi shovel and probe, but as is, it’s a great pack.

This pack is excellent for longer expeditions where you need to hold a ton of gear and food. Lots of great organizational features, and overall just very smartly designed. My only complaint is the edges of the pad on the lower back can be extremely irritating if you are only wearing a baselayer.
review.name: Quality pack with great features, not the most comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Clear lots of thought went into these. I use this as my all around climbing pack, holds a ton of gear really well but can be lightened up fairly easy if needed. Gets a lot of use (100 days a year) and still looks nearly new. Tons of well thought out compartments. This thing is great.

My only complaint is the chest strap, designed to be removable, is not good at staying in place unless buckled and in use. Nearly lost it a few times, now it stays in the zippered pouch on the top pack unless I want it for longer hikes.
review.name: Awesome pack.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Denali after reading many many reviews of other brands and knowing that you can’t go wrong with the Denali ! This backpack in the previous versions have been at rhe top of the world and in so many other moubtains !! I use it in Aconcagua with my friends. Hiking to the base camp and I wasn’t sore on my shoulders and lower back . The harness system is great! I would definitely recommend it !
review.name: Great space !!

review.reviewBody: This is supposed to be an expedition pack for long climbs or distances. Well let me tell you, after taking it on just a 3 day trip it left bruises on my hips, lower back, and my shoulders felt as if they couldn't go on anymore. The measurements for this pack are not correct for aligning it with your torso/spine, I have the alpinisto and it is more comfortable than this piece of junk. Can't believe I spent so much money on something that I absolutely will not take up Denali next summer. Honestly glad it couldn't happen this year and didn't have to use this pack on it. It would've been impossible to carry and drag everything needed for a trip like that. I'll be saving up and spending my money elsewhere on another pack so that I don't have to feel like I'm being tortured by what is supposed to be one of the most comfortable pieces of equipment on big expeditions. My wife even wore this for part of our 40 mile loop in the winds because my body couldn't handle it anymore, I literally had to make a padded belt out of my fleece just so I could bear the weight in my pack, which wasn't even that much. If I could give this pack 0 stars, I would.
review.name: Terrible

name: Denali 75L Backpack

review.reviewBody: These are fine, they do not look as sexy as the Cirque III pants which have a higher rise that I love. I also have a big booty and am unfortunately stuck with a waist gap even though it fits my bum and thighs well if not a bit trim there
review.name: Get Cirque 3 instead of Cirque 2

review.reviewBody: I bought these for uphill skiing. I also snow shoe quite a bit. They are great. They keep you warm and dry but still seem breathable. It's nice for snowshoeing that I don't need gaiters like with my other pants. These pants may be too warm for the spring snowshoeing. I am 55 yr, weigh 150, height 5' 4," and the size large fits nicely, but I do have to wear a belt as the waist is a bit too generous. I tried the medium but it was too small for me.
review.name: Suitable for skinning and snowshoeing

review.reviewBody:
I bought these because I had a pair of the original Cirque that I would have died for...but I HATE this version.
- Sizing is bizarre. They are about FOUR inches longer than the previous model and insanely tight compared to the Cirque I in the same size.
- No good place to put your phone. They got rid of the back pocket, so you can put it in your front pocket (where it rubs your thigh and digs into your lower abdomen with every step), or in the RH thigh pocket - see next point.
- RH thigh pocket is useless for anything that's not soft - because the pants are so much longer, the bottom of the pocket is at the knee and anything in the pocket rubs a raw spot on my knee.
It gets more than 1 star because it still mostly functions the way I need it to, but I can't wait for them to wear out so I can replace them with a Cirque III...which I hope has returned to the original configuration.
review.name: Horrible downgrade

review.reviewBody: These pants carried me through Alaska;s fall and into the beginning of winter until it got into the single digits.  They are my go-to pants for running, biking and hiking outside in the snow.  They fit me perfectly.  I am 5'4" and 130 lbs and a size small fits great.  The pockets are so convenient for anything.  the reinforced ankle areas make me confident they will last a long time.  I ordered 2 more pairs.
review.name: my new favorite pants

review.reviewBody: These pants PERFORM. They kept me warm and dry, they stretch and fit well. I didn’t need to, but you totally could add a layer underneath them. I LOVE the adjustable waistband. They have a reinforced panel on the inner side to protect from boots. LOTS of good pockets! These pants are tough. I would definitely recommend them for cold weather activities. I wore them on Rainier and they were perfect!
review.name: Sweet pants!

review.reviewBody: This is my second time purchasing these pants. I bought my original pair for a trip to Everest in 2021 and I wore them for weeks straight. They have great stretch, and I loved the adjustable waist and venting in particular as I tend to run hot. We had many days of cold rain on the way up and these pants kept me warm the whole time.(paired with lightweight base layer leggings). The inner leg protection for the boots is rugged and I agree with others that details such as the many zipper pockets made these pants an excellent value. These are my go-to winter hiking pants in cold-weather conditions. You will not be disappointed with these pants.
review.name: Not only would I buy again - I did!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these pants when guiding out on trips in the winter. Along with wearing them for long winter hikes. The adjustable waist Velcro is a huge win in my book since most pant waists don't fit me properly. A few other features I love on these pants in the boot lace hook, the brush guard on the ankle, and the zip close pockets. This is my second pair and they hold up so well, highly recommend them!
review.name: All time favorite soft shells!

review.reviewBody: Why do you only release a tall inseam of the cirque II pants in mens? What about the tall women?
review.name: Seem great, why do only the men's version come in tall?

review.reviewBody: love these pants, on my 3rd pair. Only complaint is the newer version is cut a lot more snug than my last 2 pairs in the exact same size (broke the leg zipper of my last pair and sadly had to get a replacement)
review.name: great touring pants!

review.reviewBody: durable material and comfortable. Block wind well. Sizing is a bit tricky, small was slightly tight especially with base layer but medium is quite a bit larger and too wide in the waist (but there are belt loops)
review.name: comfortable, warm good for all winter activities

name: Cirque II Softshell Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Fantastic- just the right weight and love the color. It's an instant basic!
review.name: Awesome!

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought one for my daughter months ago. She wearied once this year in Boston when the temperature was around 50F. It's not warm at all. Hope I can return it but has passed the date.
review.name: not warm at all

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket never leaves my fall/winter climbing kit. It's so warm, lightweight, and takes up minimal space in my pack. I'm 5'2, 120lbs, and wear a XS.
review.name: Packable and warm!

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: My husband bought it and I think it is really functional and great
review.name: I love it!

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loved the colour, warmth and lightness of the jacket but it sheds feathers a lot. Would have been nice to have a method to tighten the hood and an interior pocket for the price.
review.name: Lightweight warmth

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really appreciate how light and packable this down jacket is while maintaining impressive warmth when layered properly. The bright green color is super fun too! The fit is true to size, I opted for a small instead of extra small (I'm 5 feet tall) and I appreciate having room to layer underneath while it still having a little shape and no extra bulk under a shell jacket.
review.name: Great warmth to weight ratio

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have taken this puffy on 6 backpacking trips in the Colorado Rockies this season, and it's the best! I am an ultralight-to-lightweight backpacker with a volume obsession when it comes to my pack, and this jacket packs down so small and is so lightweight. Paired with a midlayer, I have been fine in temps down to 30 degrees F. I am a 5'6" size 10/12 woman and the Large is perfect for me, including 2-3 layers under it. It fits under my rain shell just fine. Love the hood. It's a yay for me.
review.name: Ultralight backpacker's dream puff

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this jacket!!  It is lightweight and warm, just used it when I climbed Mount Adams, WA
review.name: Wonderful, lightweight and warm jacket

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: She's warm, UL, so soft but boy is she a wee on the delicate side. Thorny bushes will easily puncture the exterior fabric. 2 backpacking trips (40 miles each) and I need at least 3 small patches.
review.name: Soft and a little sensitive

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This jacket replaced my well-worn and well-loved Women's Ghost Whisperer Jacket. Although marketed with 1000-fill RDS, I was dubious that it would be warmer as it is just as lightweight as my old one (with 800-fill RDS).  I put it to the test this morning, walking 4 miles in blustery, wintery temps, and I was just fine despite only wearing a long sleeve tee. 

Fit is comfortable, and the fabric allows movement. I'm hopeful this one is more tear resistant than my last jacket. In fairness, it held up pretty well until my rough-housing dog and her claws tore it in several spots. =/
review.name: So light, versatile

name: Ghost Whisperer UL Down Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: XT SL-M8000 I-Spec II Trigger Shifter
review.reviewBody:
If you're faced with a choice between the SLX or XT 11-speed shifters, pick up the XT and thank me later.

Why? Improved multi-release functionality over the SLX, which lets you grab one gear at a time or drop up to three at once. By comparison, the XT will permit a two-gear upshift or a four-gear downshift.

I'm not a fan of how Shimano restricts features in order to tier its groupsets, but it's part of the game and, in this case, it's worth it.
review.name: Still My Favorite 11-speed Shifter

review.itemreviewed: XT SL-M8000 I-Spec II Trigger Shifter
review.reviewBody: I upgraded from the SLX lever that came on my Yeti after I cracked the old one in an OTB. This one is a huge upgrade. What immediately stands out is the feel of the shifter: it's got a good size lever with a 'rough' face so your fingers don't slip. The action is clean and tight, which gives maximum control over the shifting. It's easy to jump a couple gears at a time. Adjustments are simple and accessible. And it seems to be holding up well. I did just go OTB again last week and cracked the mounting plate, but was able to order a new one for $10. I need to stop doing that. In case it's helpful, I have it paired with an XT derailleur and a chinese cassette with 500% range, and it runs like clockwork.
review.name: Solid upgrade

name: XT SL-M8000 I-Spec II Trigger Shifter

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack a month ago, and have been training with 65 pounds in it. The shoulder straps are terrible, dig in and very uncomfortable.  I can’t imagine going up Denali worrying about so much pain in the shoulders. I used the same amount of weight in my Osprey 50 L pack prior to this, with no pain. That pack was just too small in terms of overall capacity for Denali so I bought this one, which was recommended by the guide service.  I regret this.
review.name: Most uncomfortable shoulder straps
comment: Our Baltoro Pro 100 may be a better option for your needs as the padding and support built in the pack utilize our latest/greatest technology.

review.reviewBody: This ruck is huge, can literally fit the kitchen sink. The straps and adjustments are great to get it to fit just right, and it is very comfortable even at 80lbs. It is lacking on some side pockets and accessibility features but not. a big deal if you know how to pack and put the things you need where you need em. Best for those longer 7+ day hikes, anything less than 5 days this thing is overkill.
review.name: Great Ruck, lots of space, very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I have owned this pack for a few years. I have the The Denali Pro which this pack, 
replaced. It has been said that the original makes a list of ultimate "Bests" in camping gear of all types under large packs. I wanted to have both and my kids have a Boltoro and a Diva. This pack rivals it's forerunner and in some ways can outperforms it. Don't let the condition fool you, they have been used, just not abused. WOG
review.name: Gregory owner for a long time This is a great pac!

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack less than 1-year ago and the sternum strap loops are being torn away by the metal sternum strap fasteners.  Why this design is metal on material is boggling - but a fatal design, nonetheless.
review.name: Nice design, poor construction
comment: Thanks for leaving a review on our site!  Based on the photo you sent, I believe the problem you are experiencing is covered under our warranty policy.  Please reach out to customer service so we can further evaluate your situation.

review.reviewBody: Gregory made this 100 litre pack extremely comfortable and easy to store lots of gear
review.name: Great Giant Bag

review.reviewBody: I really like this pack. I am a 5’5 and 130 lb female wilderness therapy guide. The pack is great because I can fit everything into it (even an additional food bag). The pockets are the downfall of this pack. The side pockets don’t really hold anything if your pack is stuffed- you have to strap anything you can squeeze in there down with the straps. Overall great pack because it’s light and supportive and super comfortable.
review.name: Wilderness guide pack

review.reviewBody:
Great pack, loads easy, tons of access options and storage types. Straps are well made and easily accessible to adjust your load if needed depending on the terrain or fatigue. 

I fit the following with out issue:
10.2 x 60m rope
Double Rack up to #6, Including hexes
20 Draws, 10 singles, 6 doubles, 4 triples
20ft x 9mm anchor with 6 lockers
Harness, Shoes, Chalk, Jacket
Sleeping bag and Bivy
Food and 4L water
Strapped Additional 2L water to outside

Only reason I have to complain is it didn’t come with a rain cover...
review.name: Holds ALOT of stuff. And does it comfortably

review.reviewBody: So I really like this pack so many storage areas good fit. This pack would be good for some one much taller than 6 foot. Tons of padding to make it comfortable. The reason for this rating is simply the size of the pack makes me take extra crap with me on my trips. This will be great for our great alaskan hike we are planning. Might have to get a 65l for my shorter hikes (under 7 days). Great build solid pack recommend it just want you to understand the size.
review.name: Much larger than expected.

review.reviewBody: This pack is amazing. I packed two fully loaded bear canisters and other gear and still had room for more during a 4 day backpack in Aspen. This pack is super comfortable and distributes weight really well. It has so many pockets and loops and useful things. This will for sure be my pack for Aconcagua next winter!
review.name: Perfect pack for big trips

review.reviewBody: I took this on a float trip down the Noatak River in Alaska, it held everything I needed.
review.name: Great Pack

name: Denali 100L Backpack

Having the extra boa to dial in the fit makes a massive difference.  I have purchased and returned several pairs of boots now that were problematic for different reasons, but these are ones are absolutely perfect.  These are no doubt the best boots I have ever seen and tried on in the last 20 years I have been riding.  I regret not investing in better boots like these years ago.  True 5 star product, I highly recommend these.

review.reviewBody: I bought these bibs in December 2021, and continue to be very happy with their quality and durability. Most recently I wore them for 30 consecutive days on remote ski trip, and they were comfortable, breathable and had a lot of range on motion. I like all the deep pockets, and the avalanche-specific chest pocket. I'm 5'7", 145lbs and a medium fits great.
review.name: Still Satisfied After Several Years

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. Spending 25 hours a week riding these have held up for years. Just enough stretch, waterproof, bibs rest in a great spot. Back hatch is added bonus for not wanting to take off all your gear. As a ski patroller I love the thigh pockets too! These are not insulated but a good base or mid layer covers that! Love them, highly recommend.
review.name: Great performance

review.reviewBody: These bibs fit great and are light, stretchy and breathable. Perfect for skinning/backcountry.
review.name: Awesome bib for skinning

review.reviewBody: Very well designed gear. Love the zippers and the stretch of the fabric. For sizing reference, I originally ordered a medium, but then it was huge and returned for a small. I'm 5'6, 135 lbs and have very muscular legs/butt. I'm using these for spring skiing so have lightweight base layer beneath, but I think it would also work for a standard base layer for the winter
review.name: Great gear

review.reviewBody: I love my new overalls. Bought primarily for the drop seat and have not been disappointed. I purchased the short length and it fits well. The only negative thing I notice is that the body seems a bit long, so my crotch area looks a bit strange as the material is hanging low there, don't know how to better describe it. Ideally the short versions would have a modification to the body and not just the legs, but that doesn't seem the case. But who cares, I wear these skiing and they work great! Nice deep thigh pockets and a convenient chest pocket.
review.name: Love these, a little long in the body

review.reviewBody: bought as a birthday present for my girlfriend. got a size too big, but exchanging for the right size was simple and easy. the bib looks great and works great!
review.name: a perfect gift

review.reviewBody: I purchased these after researching and reading lots of reviews about the limited number of petite bibs. Pros: these are actually a good length (some "petite pants" are not short enough these days), these stayed dry while sitting in powdery Colorado snow, they are seam taped, and the zip down potty flap is great. Areas for improvement: the internal gaiters are not tight around my boots and therefore did not prevent snow from getting in my boots (I will likely modify mine), there are not boot clips, and the shoulder straps don't have buckles. I wish it had fleece lined hand warmer pockets in the front also. I am 5'1" and 110lbs. I am right in-between the XS and S sizes. I ended up going with the S because of some reviewers mentioning sizing up. I wish I had gone with the XS. The S are a little baggy even with multiple layers underneath. I had to pull the straps up as much as I could. I would have exchanged them, but we got three feet of snow and I wanted to help my husband with snow shoveling.
review.name: Nice! But there is room for improvement

review.reviewBody: After trying on so many bibs in person and not finding a pair that fit my body type, I was hesitant to order online. However, these are the first pair of bibs I've purchased that flatter my figure but are also comfortable & functional. For reference, I am 5'3" 155lbs (size 8/10 in pants). Also love the zippers that make it easier for women to go to go to the bathroom! Wish I would have ordered earlier!!
review.name: Love These!

review.reviewBody: Sat on wet ski lift a few times, base layers stayed dry. Breathable during hard powder runs and ski touring.
review.name: Water resistant / breathable

review.reviewBody: Cute design but very thin material. Started seeing tearing after one day of use. I will keep them because I got the matching jacket but I would not buy these again.
review.name: Cute but thin

name: Skytour AscentShell Bib Pant - Women's

This is a club fit - I would wear a small or size 4 in regular clothing but unless you want your jerseys skin tight like the TdF, you will appreciate the club cut. I have a medium and it fits close - there is  no flapping of loose fabric. The silicon band on the bottom holds it nicely in place but isn't elastic or tight (and I am a pear shape, so bigger hips than shoulders). Washes great. Would recommend!
review.name: Good basic jersey

I love the way the material feels and I feel really nice in it. I mostly wear a large in toad and Co clothes but XL was the only size available. I don't notice much difference. I'm very happy with my purchase

review.reviewBody: The Rosalinda dress is by far my favorite article of clothing. I have it in 3 different colors, and I love all of them. They can be dressed up or worn casually, and are super comfy. I'm around 5'7", and this dress falls right above my knee; it looks much shorter on the models. Buy this dress, you won't be sorry!
review.name: My favorite dresses

review.reviewBody: Amazing dress, very high-quality. Can dress up or down. Thick enough to not show panty line. Was a little longer than I expected, closer to knee-length than shown on the model. I'm a 34C chest and it fit but was slightly tight - if you have a larger chest, size up.
review.name: Gorgeous

review.reviewBody:
The jacket looks nice but I highly doubt it can be recommended for mountaineering as advertised because Cordura reinforced areas become wet under water instantly even with fresh DWR. Considering Cordura is used for shoulders area which gets wet first under rain I suspect this jacket is not practical for alpine pursuits where wether can change throughout the day.
I don't expect softshell to be waterproof but it should not get wet in a few moments.
review.name: Good design but lacks weather protection

review.reviewBody: Very nice, very glad I ordered it. The Vetiver/Kiwi is more green, nothing like the picture, many shades  lighter than a dark military green, but in that family. Nice fleece and the price on the Vetiver/Kiwi is great. I was lucky that a medium, the only size available in it was a good fit. Maybe I could have worn a small but this one really works well for my 5'6 130 pound frame. Sleeves as always are a bit long for me. Also Marmot is one of my preferred brands along with Outdoor Research.
review.name: A bit oversized, high quality fleece

review.reviewBody: Great product. Even better...warmer than expected! Color matched as well.
review.name: As Advertised!

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket so much I bought two of them. I’m glad I did because my girlfriend stole one and refuses to give it back.
review.name: Incredibly comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I also bought Patagonia's along with the Marmot sweater/jacket and seem like they both have the same issues.  Although, it is not too critical to affect my use purpose, the gears' sleeves length are a little long.  Too me I can always fold and it will be fine.  I like this gear as well as the other brand and for the price it's a good buy.  I can not find this color and style in Patagonia, but it works out well.  If not for the sleeves issue, I will easily rate this gear a 5 stars.
review.name: Best for cold weather and not too cold.

review.reviewBody: Had this fleece jacket for awhile.  Every time I ware it I get compliments.
review.name: Quality materials, great colors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this fleece at around 60% off and I really like it, however I don’t know if I would buy it at full price. Nothing wrong with it just on the pricier side.
review.name: Good but a little pricey

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cozy, very nice looking and washes great. Worth it
review.name: Worth it, don’t hesitate to purchase this one!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice color. Warm and comfortable. Like zip up pouch

review.reviewBody: The vetiver/kiwi colorway looks way different in  person, online it looks tan/beige, in real life it's a light green color. Otherwise it's a decent fleece. Fits pretty true to size

review.reviewBody: Bought this pad as a gift for a bouldering buddy, that is just starting to get into the sport. Really great quality and the colors are so bright and colorful! Also the straps are perfect for packing them on approaches, they have the comfortable shoulder straps along with a handy waist strap. Would defiantly recommend for someone wanting to get into the sport or start with something on the cheaper side of crash pads but still have the same quality as more expensive pads!
review.name: Great Starter Pad

review.reviewBody: Well thought out design and lightweight pads. Easy to carry two pads together. Excited to get more use out of them.
review.name: Solid Pads

review.reviewBody: Great pad, good size and awesome add ons like Velcro to help connect it to other pads. The only downside I’ve found is that I could use some longer straps for the sides when I need to strap another pad of a different brand on the back to carry an extra pad. Pretty easily fixable but it would be nice to have the extra length initially. Backpack straps carry very well even when you load up the middle with gear and snacks.
review.name: Great pad but could have some extra straps

review.reviewBody: I wanted to use it for a crash pad couch and it works great!

review.reviewBody:
I was thinking about buying this guy for the longest time. I bit the bullet and I was not disappointed, Rain, Wind and hail, this jacket has blown me away.

the jacket is very light, which I'm afraid if I put something sharp it might tear a hole in a pocket or if I'm caught on a branch or thorns while bike riding, otherwise it packs up nicely to travel, in the brisk morning I found a t-shirt and this jacket to be a bit chilling. with the elastic waist and wrists, layering up is not a problem. the hood is a bit tight. so it might pull off your toque or hat. but once its on its snug and feels really good. well worth the purchase if the Fjallraven description meets your requirements. this will be the jacket for my next journey overseas
review.name: Hundreds of kilometers to go....

review.reviewBody: This 'midsummer' jacket is actually quite warm for a summer jacket. For wearing in the city at temperatures over 16 C it can be quick to overheat. It may be that the first time wearing prior to washing the wax reduces the breathability. It is simple, subtle yet somewhat stylish for a jacket designed for hiking.
review.name: Modest quality jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket actually surprised me a bit. I wasn’t quite sure what to expect but it is exactly as I’d hoped. I wanted a light jacket that would provide some coverage from the wind gusts as I reached peaks and summits during my hikes. This jacket does so well. It is not wind proof and does not advertise to be. It’s a very light material and you can see light through it when held to a bulb. The stretch fabric feels wonderful. It may not be as stretchy as elastane but it is surprisingly stretchy given the texture of the jacket. The hood performs well and can be adjusted with two drawstrings and cinch cords. There is a small zipped chest pocket and two zipped hand pockets. I can access the chest pocket easily when wearing a pack. If I get too warm I just unzip the pockets and let the mesh liner ventilate some heat. The cuffs are elastic and I find they fit well. I have small wrists and they don’t fall up my arm. I love this jacket so much I own two. The Savanna color is exactly what I wanted, like a light olive and tan color. The jacket can be packed down very small. It can be packed into its own pocket but I’ve also found it easy to roll it into the hood. The weight is feather like but I’ve worn it a few times when carrying my pack and noticed zero durability issues thus far. I have also been using this in mild Autumn weather as an extra protective layer. I find when I wear this over my Keb Fleece Hoodie, it adds just enough extra warmth when needed. The jacket breathes exceptionally well. I find it comparable to the Ferrosi jacket, just with less synthetic materials. I am well pleased with the design of this jacket. I’m 5’10” 150lbs and could fit a small or medium. The small was very fitting but comfortable due to the stretch of the jacket. I went with a medium so I can layer under it as I want.
review.name: Surprised Me

review.reviewBody: After receiving this amazing Abisko Midsummer Jacket M in the mail and quickly opening it... I knew I had made the right decision. This jacket is built to last and the materials are top notch! I have no doubt that this jacket will handle all the remote backcountry adventures I plan on going on. I will for sure be back here to write a more in-depth review. If you would like to follow along with me on my journey, find me on youtube by typing "pnwfullstop". See you in the backcountry my friend.
review.name: A New Adventure Begins!

review.reviewBody: This jacket really has it all! Packs down small. Is super lightweight. The fabric is breathable and comfortable to throw on at the top of a peak or when the wind picks up on a hike. My husband likes that the shoulders, arms and hood have a different fabric that is more durable for extra weather protection and durability when wearing a pack.
review.name: The Summer Hiking Jacket You Need

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the Ochre color in person! The G-1000 Air across the shoulders and hood makes for a formidable light rain jacket while being so light weight and breathable during warmer temps. Being able to utilize my Greenland wax at home to increase its water resistance while maintaining its lightness is a real gift!
review.name: That Ochre Color!

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots about a month ago. They are replacing a lighter and more flexible mesh hiker. I have been wearing these boots to walk, do light hiking, and to hunt in and I really appreciate their build. They are stiffer than a your typical mesh textile boot but I appreciate that. However, I would say they take a little time to break in. I can’t speak to long term durability, but so far they  are what I was hoping for in a boot. They have kept my feet dry while walking through tall grass saturated with dew. No complaints so far from me.
review.name: Solid boot

review.reviewBody:
Updating this quite a while later - the soles do wear out, and you can rip off some small chunks pretty early on if you're hiking rugged enough terrain. This has happened with other boots I've tried though, so I think it just comes with the territory. It didn't affect the comfort or performance really. 

***

My dudes, I agonized over which pair of boots I wanted to buy next.  I had some mid-range Scarpas I spent about $190 on, and they were fine, but after 9-10 miles on a 14er, my feet ached something fierce, even with trekking poles (though those did help tremendously, especially the knees. Alas I digress). 
I was up to seventeen 14,000-ft peaks and am totally addicted, so I wanted to level up. 
An insane former roommate had climbed all 58 14ers in CO (I know there's only 53 officially, but you negative nancies can suck it haha). He strongly recommended these boots and was on his 2nd pair. 
The reviews about the vibram wearing out spooked me a bit, but I tried them on at an REI, and holy cow, they just felt like a dream right off the bat. I have narrow feet, and these things cup my heels beautifully; no slippage whatsoever. 
The toe box is plenty roomy as well - and if you have wide feet, you can just grab the GTX Lux version which is only $40 more I believe. 
I strongly considered the Lowa GTX Camino boot as well, but these Zamberlans just felt more comfortable. 
I've worn them on Missouri Mountain and Castle & Conundrum, and my feet have felt superb the whole time. Some very minor pinching here and there every now and then as I've warmed up, but no significant hot spots and no blisters whatsoever. 
They are truly the most comfortable boots I've ever owned. And yes, there are some scratches and knicks on the boot after 30 miles of hiking or so, but what do you expect after slogging through jagged rocks, talus, and scree? 
I do wonder if maybe some of the reviewers below just got a bad batch or something. 
Anyhoo, just get them some place with an awesome return policy and you'll be fine. And invest in Zamberlan's hydrobloc cream - it's very inexpensive and makes the boots look practically new after any hike, plus it repels water amazingly.
review.name: Beyond comfortable, soles do wear
comment: Hey Ryan. I just bought a pair of these boots. They look and feel great. However I am having a difficult time getting answers about the warmth of the boots. I live in Michigan and do sometimes walk for a few hours at a time in 10 to 20 degree weather. Any thoughts about these boots and those Temps. Thanks

review.reviewBody:
I have never been more impressed with a hiking boot. I used to be an Asolo fan but wow Zamberlan has set the mark way high. These boots are amazing straight out of the box and right onto my feet. I feel as though they fit true to size (10) for my feet. No issues with any warm spots what so ever after many long walks with them on.  

I have always lived by the mantra spare no expense for your feet...you only get one pair in your lifetime so treat them well and with these boots I have done just that.
review.name: Best Hiking Boots

name: Vioz GTX Backpacking Boot- Men's

review.reviewBody: I was just looking for some warm cozy flannel shirts for casual wear. These just stood out, because the plaid colors are so versatile. There are colors that will match everything in my jean, sweater, blazer, vests, wardrobe. So, I took the chance, and on my first purchase from Backcountry, purchased all 5 shirts offered. Best purchase ever!!! Quality is outstanding! Just as pictured. Nothing flimsy about this material. Well made. Vibrant colors. A good weight fabric that you’d expect in a garment you’ll be wearing all fall and winter. Comfy cozy just can’t say enough. Next year for sure I’ll add to my flannel collection. Now on to the women’s boots…..
review.name: Worth Every Dollar

review.reviewBody: So happy I bought this!  It is so soft, warm, and comfortable.  Fits true to size.
review.name: Soft and warm

review.reviewBody: The Gearhead Green color is absolutely perfect!  Hard to find good color combos on flannels.  The sleeves were just a tad too short, but didn't want to size up as it was already a bit boxy.  I took great care to follow directions and dry on low, but sadly still lost another inch on the arm length.  This will be a rolled up sleeve only shirt for me.  Please Backcountry, make the sleeves a bit longer next time.  Otherwise, a great shirt!
review.name: Perfect color!

name: Venture Classic Flannel Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'm not a pro and have only worn a couple different shoes, but I love these Shadows! Bought my street shoe size and after a few sessions they fit great. Love the single strap, always had two before. They toe the line between thick rubber and flexible, which suits me perfectly (I only climb indoors). Plus, I dig the all black look way more than I thought I would.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: I got half a size under what i get for regular shoes and after breaking them in they are great. Everything about the shoes sticks super well
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: please buy 1 size up from what u currently wear. I’m a US men size 9 so i bought a size 9, my toes feel like there bending in half. Now i need to re buy them but in a 10
review.name: SIZE UP

review.reviewBody: I’m not sure who did the sizing on this Climbing shoe but it’s absolutely so far off I just don’t get it. I’ve been Climbing for 35 years and I’ve gone through dozens of shoes in that time. I’ve never worn larger than a 9 1/2 or 10 Climbing shoe I ordered this shoe three different times in the ended up ordering a 12.5. how can it be off so much. The tow box is way too small and pinches your toes over as well as the space above the foot has way too much room I’ve climbed in the shoe for the last 2-3 weeks, hoping it would somehow start to work and it just doesn’t . might want to take a little more time and researching and development in this shoe. And I’m a black diamond fan fan through and through
review.name: Needs research

review.reviewBody: I have probably 5- 6different Climbing shoes. All of them are size 10 this was my newest addition to my shoes after ordering a 10 1/2 that didn’t fit I ordered an 11 1/2 and it was super tight as well. Not even close. Not sure who did the sizing on these but they’re way off I have a size 12! Coming to me But they’re way off.
review.name: Size not even close

review.reviewBody: The grip with these shoes is incredible. Heel and toe hook with ease. New favorite shoes
review.name: Wow

review.reviewBody: Feel on indoor and outdoor is great. There's no thoughts of "i hope my foot holds" when using these. I wear a street 11 and went with a 10.5 and its perfectly uncomfortable.
review.name: Love It!

review.reviewBody: The structure of the shoe is great; very aggressive design.  However, there is no return permitted and the shoe is not true to size.
review.name: SIZE

review.reviewBody: nice soft and precise shoe, great for bouldering. The fit could be better. there is a nice pocket for the knuckle of your big toe, but overall the show is very low volume. expect to size up a minimum of a half size over your street shoe.
review.name: decent shoe

review.reviewBody: My first impression was that it was more of a basic shoe; after bouldering and route climbing in them for a few weeks, they toe-in and hold on small edges very well. I’ve done a few heel hooks on route that held on smaller edges that stuck. Also, the shape of the shoe started to evolve with my foot shape. Overall, happy about the purchase and have a few ideas for improvements.
review.name: Surprised

name: Shadow Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I own 3 pairs of Cabo Shorts and love them, however, when I ordered these they were longer than my original pair and bigger. The fit is just not the same as my originals which I bought in 2022. hasVariant.name: Morrison Evo 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountainsmith Morrison Evo 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this tent after reading many positive reviews on other platforms, and was extremely happy with its performance. When set up properly, which is both fast and simple, it is very sturdy and good in inclement weather. I happened to get caught in a freak hail / rain storm while out on a 5 day trip, and the structure held strong and the rainfly kept the tent dry. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a roomy 2 person tent (how I use it) that will hold in weather.
review.name: Excellent Tent for Car Camping

review.reviewBody:
I used this with the wife and 2 kids on a late-summer overnighter in the mountains. It was pretty easy to setup, and it was nice that it came with its own footprint.

Despite not planning for it, we had a couple rain showers during night and had no leaks.  When I disassembled it, I found that some moisture had accumulated on the inside of the outer barrier, but still nothing dripped through.
review.name: Easy to set up, light-ish, kept us dry

name: Morrison Evo 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Amazing bag! So much space and is mostly water proof. I love the extra pocket in the inside and the pocket of the outside. The extra handles and backpack straps are super nice to have. The zippers are a little clunky and stick sometimes. Overall an amazing purchase.
review.name: I would absolutely buy this bag again

review.reviewBody: I currently own 3(S,M,XL) Base Camp Duffels. I've brought my M on countless trips and have loved it for close to 6 years. I purchased a new one and realized it's not the same. The new design is awful.
review.name: Quality has diminished

review.reviewBody: I use this bag for work and it's great. I am a Wildland firefighter and this bag is perfect for your personal gear. I can fit my tent, sleeping bag, and a small pillow on top of clothes and other items. I like the material and from my experience it's very durable and can handle a lot. The zippers are very heavy duty, and the pack straps make it easier to haul around.
review.name: Very good buy, highly recommend

review.reviewBody: I use this product for traveling and it's amazing!
review.name: I love this bag

review.reviewBody: I plan on using thia bag to camp, perfect size & enough room to fit every I need.
review.name: I plan on buying this product again but the Xl

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was hoping for. The material seems durable, the duffel is sufficiently spacious, and I LOVE the fact that it includes straps to wear it like a backpack.
review.name: You can wear it like a backpack. SOLD.

review.reviewBody: Bag is exactly as described. Very happy with purchase
review.name: Worth it

review.reviewBody: So versatile. Something a person who combines outdoor / family outings can use.
review.name: I bought another for a gift.

review.reviewBody: Great quality, enough space I will definitely go with the XL next tome
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: 95Lt is Great Value for the Money... Just put anything you need (for vacation, camping, activities near the sea or mountain, hotels etc & throw it in the car, or strap it properly on your motorcycle !!! You will NEVER regret buying it !!! Just choose the RIGHT SIZE for YOU...

review.reviewBody: Great jacket to throw on in the wind or light use.
review.name: Perfect to block the wind

review.reviewBody: The fabric is extremely fragile. I've got a snagged thread the third time wearing the jacket. And I have been wearing it only in town. How is the jacket supposed to survive outdoors? However the look and the feel is great.
review.name: The fabric is fragile.

review.reviewBody: The large fits perfect on my 6’, 195 body. Two hand pockets, ultra light, and a standup collar make it a great piece to always have when heading out for a hike. Similar to my Patagonia Houdini minus the hood but with the benefit of two functional pockets.
review.name: Kor Airshell Jacket

review.reviewBody: I've had this jacket for a bit and the only gripe is the sleeve hole is huge on the xl. Not understanding why the cut out is so large. I took it in for an alteration and there's no jacket better for hanging out.
review.name: Top shelf jacket

review.reviewBody: Stylish and the answer to that temperature range between perfect and chilly.  Super light and almost unnoticeable in your pack, luggage or center car console. I highly recommend this jacket as part of your kit.
review.name: My go to light jacket

review.reviewBody: So far so good.  I have worn it in cold weather as a layer garment over a base layer for walking and hiking.  (I put an insulation layer over that....) Something like 10 times as of now.  It is doing what I planned.  It packs down very small and along with that, is very light.  In such a layering configuration as I described, 20+ mph winds and 25 degree F did not bother me.
review.name: Kor Air-shell Jacket Doing What It Is Supposed To

review.reviewBody: Both of my sons really liked this lightweight jacket!
review.name: A Jacket POP

review.reviewBody:
I was hoping that this jacket was going to be a wind layer for me while playing golf and it has worked out really well.  It is NOT wind proof but it does stop a lot of the wind, and it is breathable so it will not be like wearing a trash bag. The jacket is super light and you can not really feel it while it is on and it does not really make a lot of sound either when you move.

When you are not wearing it, it can pack down into a very small size so this thing tics a lot of boxes.  It is one of those jackets where you keep thinking of ways you can use it, rather than intending a jacket for something and figuring out that you can not use it for this or that,

I am thrilled with this one - an amazing layering piece or as the outer shell.
review.name: Awesome Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is my third airshell from MH and it won’t be my last. First without hood and it’s great for running and I don’t live as cold of a climate now so I don’t need the hood for 90% of my runs and hikes. These things are the best and I have put them through everything.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight and just enough to not need a puff jacket.
review.name: Very lightweight

name: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I went down a size in jeans, etc. recently so got these in my "new" size.  Oh, they are soft yet substantial.  The blue color is gorgeous.  The pockets are great - deep and useful.  The butt fits great for this athletic gal, and the legs, too, with a little more give/opening than is shown in most of the gorgeous models' photos here.  However, even just taking them out of the box, wow, I noticed the waist was tiny.  There's a little stretch, but, again as shown in most of the model photos here, the waist pulls at the button there, it's relatively tight for the size.  And I'm a lean gal (albeit with some late middle-aged female softness at the waist).  I'm going to size up and see if any better.
review.name: tight waist but otherwise wonderful

review.reviewBody:
This is a great fire pit and one that has accompanied me on a lot of camping trips. It is a genius design and built to last a lifetime. That comes at the expense of weight but it packs easily, sets up in a snap and loads well into a vehicle for travel.

The amount of cooking and burning accessories for this pit is awesome and we have used it to make many meals outdoors.

The only downside is that it could draft a bit better but if you add the Floga attachment when not cooking that becomes a non-issue.
review.name: A Swiss Army Knife for Campfires

name: Pack & Carry Fireplace

review.reviewBody:
Lovely and warm jacket! Runs a little small, but it’s meant to be fitted. I wish it was a little less puffy, especially near my bottom. I took on star off because the material sadly stains very easily, the stains did not wash out and for the price point that wasn’t expected. I’ve had the jacket for a few months, I do not wear it daily. 
Not sure I’d recommend it due how easy it stains and the price point. If money is no issue I’d say, go for it.
review.name: Warm and Stylish

review.reviewBody: It’s a very nice coat and for the price should be made to prevent stains from settling into the fabric. I bought this coat less than 2 weeks ago. After wearing it out, I noticed a stain on it possibly from leaning on something or just interacting with the public during the day.  In the army color the stain is noticeable. I have washed it following the instructions but the stain is still too visible for the coat being at this price point. Definitely not an everyday jacket.
review.name: Very nice coat but stains easily

review.reviewBody:

review.reviewBody: I went to the location at Spring street in NY and Ashley was her name. She was so so helpful. I bought a coat years ago and loved the brand. She was so patient and helpful. She gave me her honest opinion and I love my coats!! If you are in the NY area please ask for her.

review.reviewBody: love the color and warmth however the coat runs small
review.name: the beautiful coat
comment:
Hi There,
Thank you for sharing your review with us.
The MADALYN is a fitted model - our closest to the body signature fit.
We're sorry to hear that the size you chose runs small on you.
Our sizes are generally quite accurate, however, seeing as we are all made differently not everyone will fit into a coat the same way.
Our size guide available on our site will give you a better idea of what size may be best for you.
Feel free to DM us if you have any further questions or concerns.
Cheers!

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is not true to size and trying to mail this item due to the holiday season . I ordered a small be cause I’m
Usually a size small but in this jacket I’m probably a m or large . I tried on a medium and it’s still very restricted in the boob and arm area . Like it might rip if I move too sudden . My height is 5’4 and 125 …wearing a large …make it make sense
review.name: Jacket is size way toooo small
comment:
Hi There!
Thank you for sharing your review with us.
We are sorry to hear that the coat you have purchased is too small on you.
Our sizes are generally quite accurate, however, seeing as we are all made differently in different areas it is quite understandable that not everyone will fit into a size the same way. 
Our size guide, available to the right of the image you select can help you determine the size appropriate for you.
If you have any further inquiries, please send us a DM and we will be delighted to assist you further.
Cheers!

review.reviewBody: a little tight but fit okay! very warm and cute. love the look.
review.name: amazing!

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My original order got lost so I wound up with a different color than I'd planned (the red ones with red fish) but I still love them. Work great for puttering around in cold temps and mud, and I really dig that I can kick them on barefoot to walk the dog in the morning and when I pull my feet out the liners don't come with them. Wasn't expecting them to be as well-insulated as they are, and heck- they're even kind of cute.
review.name: Easy on/off, surprisingly warm

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boats.  My friend is going to buy the same pair.
review.name: Love boats

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are always a winner! I have many pairs and I use them for everything!
review.name: Always a winner!

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots… They’re cute and functional. I use them anywhere. I think my feet could get wet very comfortable.
review.name: Cute and functional

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really liked these, and the actual product doesn’t differ from the picture. However, as soon as they’re put on, one resembles Ronald McDonald. So, I actually sent them back and got something a little more toned down. If you’re the bold kind, these are for you!
review.name: Great! In theory…

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I always loved their boots but for some reason this pair ran small and has a strange bump towards the heel making it very uncomfortable.
review.name: Not the same comfort as prior purchase

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these! Quality as I’ve come to expect from XTRA TUF and super cute colors/fish print!  Lots of compliments on these each time I wear!
review.name: Cute Print/Tuf Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Never thought it would be me, but I tripped pulling the lawn mower backwards and let’s just say I’ve never been more glad to have my favorite boots on. I’m not saying they didn’t get wrecking , but even the EMT said they literally saved my last 3 toes! (So sorry, I’m healing totally fine.) anyway. I always liked these boots because they’re cute and so easy for a mom with a chaotic life, but turns out… they’re actually xtra tuf! Thank y’all
review.name: The name says it all. (TW: injury!)

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for a salmon fishing trip this summer but I ended up returning them, I wear a half size and the options were either too big or too small. Even with thick socks still a little too big :(
review.name: Cute but wish they came in half sizes

review.itemreviewed: Ankle Salmon Sisters 6in Deck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Purchased less than 2 months ago, already have holes in the upper foot area.
review.name: Dissatisfied

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Tempest 24L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tempest 24L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Tempest 24L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: There are so many features on this bag. Many can be adjusted. Bottle pockets on the side are big and can be tightened. Plenty of pockets inside to store bits away from the main compartment. Back straps can be adjusted using the velcro to move the straps higher or lower. The waist pockets are actually big enough to hold a smart phone as well as lots of snacks for hikes. Just a really good backpack and good quality.
review.name: Great backpack. Super comfy.

review.reviewBody: Great bag, plenty of space and pockets, comfortable and excellent at carrying weight with minimal pressure on the shoulders.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Perfect for distance events as a day bag, good size and features.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: I already own the tempest 20 but wanted something that would hold a bit more for longer day hikes. This bag was perfect! Very comfortable, fits a lot and also fits my torso very well. Hard to beat the adjustable frame. The straps nicely fit my peak design camera clip too!
review.name: Very comfortable and fits a lot!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love love love this pack. I’m not that experienced a hiker however I do know comfort. This pack is well-made. The frame allows it to move as you move without having deadweight on your shoulders. I got this pack the 24 L a little larger than my 22 for my Grand Canyon rim to rim hike, it doesn’t come up until October but with my practice hikes I find this to be very comfortable this pack. Also, the hip pockets are larger than most so you can put snacks and other important items that you need there. Easy access to use it from my room to thank you Osprey for helping me choose this one pack .
review.name: Love love love this pack.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s great pack, but does NOT seem to hold much more than the 20L. One medium weight down jacket that compacts into a pocket fit in there with the same things I had packed in my 20L. Was hoping it would be a bit bigger. It really isn’t much.
review.name: It’s great pack, but does

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this backpack, specially the back support and the little pockets
review.name: I love this backpack, specially

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is just the perfect pack for me! I love it. It feels like I have nothing on and carries weight well. I love the color (purple) and all the features. The waist pocket fits my iPhone 15 Pro Max. I’m 5’6” with a long torso about 20 inches or so and it fits great.
review.name: This is just the perfect

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted to love this backpack because the frame does fit my short torso (I got the XS/S)
But: the belt is at the same level as the lumbar curve, so it does not transfer the weight to the hips, but is basically ties it around your waist. It is also cut straight, like a wide belt, instead of flaring out a bit to sit on my hips.
Too bad, because I would have expected better from Osprey.
review.name: I wanted to love this

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love my new backpack, perfect size for long day hike and comfortable with all the easily adjusted straps including load lifters. I like being able to put a water bladder in the separate outside pocket, and not having to put it in the main compartment. I also appreciate the zippered pockets for easy access to smaller stuff and keeps wallet/keys secure. 
The hip pockets are also nice and accommodate a fair amount, even though not quite big enough for a larger size cell phone.
Taking one star off because the mesh pocket on the shoulder strap is useless. It’s too small and if you do fit something in there, the button closure does not hold and pops open all the time. 
I’m very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Love my new backpack, perfect

name: Tempest 24L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I was actually looking for a thinner fleece for cool days and layering. I needed a replacement for a beloved  North Face pullover which is becoming a little threadbare. This pullover is perfect to me. I am a true size small, but my neighbor has one and suggested I size up because it "shrinks a little".  I ordered a medium and I'm glad I did. The sleeves are a little long and I have a little room in the body, but it's OK. On cooler days, I can wear a medium weight wool shirt underneath and feels comfortable. I'm buying another one before they change it.
review.name: Yes, I love it.

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Alpine Onset Merino 150 Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Beanie
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Alpine Onset Merino 150 Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got this as a gift for a friend for Christmas, who had requested a very warm winter hat. The red color is really nice and I'm glad it's merino, but it is shockingly thin and in no way would work as a winter hat in Michigan. Maybe you could use it as a liner for another hat, although that seems needlessly complicated. I cannot get over the claims that it will work in single digit temperatures - I assure you as someone who regularly buys merino socks and backpacking underlayers, that's not true. It's way too thin, especially if there is any kind of breeze. Holding the material up, it's easily see through. Again, the burgundy color is nice, and if you want a stylish hat for the mildest temperatures, this might be for you, but I cannot give this to my friend. I'll be looking for an actually warm hat, instead.
review.name: Thin enough to see through

review.reviewBody: Perfect for high-performance activities. I love this for running and temperatures below 40°. The Marino will is excellent for not trapping sweat. Sometimes I will double it up if it’s very cold and they still stay breathable. This is also great for casual wear because it fits nicely in a pocket. Unlike a bulky thick hat. And it’s also great for wearing under a helmet such as a ski helmet. Love the Alpine onset Marino beanie!
review.name: Perfect for so many things

review.reviewBody: Very thin. Doesn’t even cover my ears.  For the price, very disappointed.
review.name: thinner then pantyhose

name: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Beanie

review.reviewBody: This harness is lightweight, comfortable, and the gear loops are sufficiently sized. The major issue with this (and other Petzl harnesses) is that the gear loops are prone to breaking because they are encased in a thin fabric that holds them to the harness. If this fabric rubs against rock at all, like climbing in a chimney, it can easily wear through and cause you to lose all of your gear (potentially dangerous on long complex multi-pitch routes or for your belayer below if you drop gear on them). Although, this harness ought to be adequate if you are only doing gym/sport climbing that won't put your harness in contact with the wall at all.  I've reached out to Petzl to ask for a replacement harness, but they won't stand by their product.
review.name: Dangerous design

name: Hirundos Harness

review.reviewBody: I've been in pursuit of my perfect paddle.  have several hybrid paddles and a couple carbon paddles, including a 240cm Whitewater paddle (Perception) and my ranking was 24cm Aquabound Manta Ray and Perception Whitewater CF as my favorites, depending on situation.  Now I may have a new favorite.  The hero grip is so much more comfortable that I don't need gloves and I really like that. The blade size seems just right.  It is as powerful as the Whitewater, but no more tiring on a sprint than the Manta Ray.  And, it is even better at doing both high angle power paddling and lower angle cruising than the Manta Ray.  It seems to maneuver my boat forward, backward and in turns, including multiple spins, a little better.  It is a little heavier in terms of weight, but the power makes up for it, so I think it is now my first go to paddle and should be in any situation except possibly frenzied whitewater, but I won't know until I try.
review.name: My most comfortable and powerful paddle

name: Hero Angler Paddle

hasVariant.description: Buy the Craft Pro Nano Jersey - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Great jersey. I struggle to find jerseys with enough coverage in the sleeves and torso to fit my 6’2” 145lb frame. I’m built like Gumby. This jersey in a size medium is an excellent fit. It’s a super lightweight jersey so layering with a baselayer for cooler temps is good, and wearing it by itself is the move for hot days. 

Comfy in a riding position, flat or raw seams, solid price point, racey fit but not super compressive, 3 open pockets with one zip pocket for cash, cards, and ID. Can’t ask for much more. 

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads

review.reviewBody: Form fitting, very good quality, perfect for a hot summer day. The back pocket could be slightly deeper but overall they do the job.
review.name: Very good quality

description: Buy the Smith Redding Glass ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Redding Glass ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Redding Glass ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Redding Glass ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Redding Glass ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: When I bought these I could swear I saw Len replacement available for these. Currently not listed online. My frames are excellent. No need for a total replacement. Can I buy just lenses plz
review.name: Nice but…..

review.reviewBody: I bought 2 pairs of Smith 3 years ago, they are ok in and around town, inland etc, But I fish ALOT and anytime the sun is out on the water I'm getting a strange mettalic like refraction/reflection on the lower part of the lenses, its very frustrating since these are supposed to be premium grade, I have 1 pair of Redding with polarized bronze glass, and 1 pair of Guides Choice polarized bronze glass, both sets of glasses do the same thing. The frames are very light and the hinges are pretty delicate, based on my experience I cannot recommend them . When I go fishing or boating I don't leave home without my Amber lensed Maui's.
review.name: Not even close to my Maui's

review.reviewBody: I fish the Texas coast year round and have worn many other brands none as able to take a drop at work and also be the clearest glass on the water. A great product overall.
review.name: Best sunglasses I’ve owned

review.reviewBody: We live on Cape Hatteras and. spend many hours on the beach. Redding provides the comfort and protection we need. The polarized glass lens is exactly what is needed in these high UV light conditions.
review.name: Life on a Sandbar

review.reviewBody: Bought to wear for outdoor running and hiking. Very pleased with fit and high quality lenses. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great sunglasses!

review.reviewBody: I loved the clarity of these glasses, but while fighting a salmon the hook came out of the fish, the line with sinkers came back hitting me in the glasses, and shattering them. I had to go to the hospital to get a tiny shard of glass out of my eye. I think I’d rather sacrifice a little clarity for the safety of my eyesight.
review.name: I did like them, but

review.reviewBody: I got the Redding’s to replace my no longer manufactured Guides choice. They are light, fit REALLY well, and the Chroma Pop lenses are AMAZING! My old ones worked great on the water with their polarized lenses, but the greens of foliage render way better with these. A winner!
review.name: Great fit

name: Redding Glass ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: My family & I are going to Disney World in April 2025 & my sister told me to get these sandals way ahead of time so that I could "break them in". I've worn them from the first day I got them and after adjusting the straps, they've needed no breaking in and are perfectly comfortable!
review.name: I love these sandals!

review.reviewBody: I would buy these again for my kids. They have held up for the last two months and are easy to clean after muddy weeks at camp.
review.name: I would buy these again for my kids

review.reviewBody: My kids love these!! So comfortable, supportive and cute :)
review.name: Great summer sandals!

review.reviewBody: My grandson loves these sandals! They look great and I know they will last him until he outgrows them! I'll definitely be buying them again, in the next size up! He's looking forward to wearing them when we all go on vacation soon!
review.name: I will definitely be buying these again!

review.reviewBody: Nice weight and seems comfortable and supportive for general wear and moderate hiking. Price is reasonable. Very accomodating and fast in return and exchange process when I ordered the wrong size.
review.name: I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: They are really durable for our 9 year old twin granddaughters! They go through shoes poorly made before they outgrow them. Won't be the case with these!
review.name: I will definitely buy more for the grandkids!

review.reviewBody: My son loves them. Good all year round, but we only wear them during summer because living in a snow state and cold makes it impossible to wear them year round. But it is durable, light, movable, comfy, and ground grip is good. Highly recommend these.
review.name: Kids loved them!

review.reviewBody: My 7 yo granddaughter was thrilled. They're just like yours like Nana! Adorable, well made, great fit and comfortable. If in between sizes, go up as they may run just a smidge small.
review.name: Just like Nana's!

review.reviewBody: bought this pair for my granddaughter..her 1st pair
review.name: life time wearer of Tevas

review.reviewBody: Fit is perfect for my active daughter and super cute design.
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: Purchased a pair of these, they seem really well made, but they're really large.  I think every other pair of gloves/mittens I've owned in the last 20 years have been mediums.  Got these in a medium, and they're just way too bulky and oversized, so I returned them.
review.name: Nice, but they're huge

review.reviewBody: These gloves are awesome. They keep my hands warm In -15 degrees and not a drip on water gets into them. Most of the gloves I have owned tend to get wet and cold over time but these keep their warmth throughout the year.
review.name: Keeps em’ warm and dry

review.reviewBody: I got pretty severe frostbite on a finger this winter at work. As soon as I expose it to cold it goes numb. I have been a glove guy most of my snowboarding/skiing life and now I can’t wear any glove because of the frost bite. I tried a couple mitts and eventually found these. I was impressed when I got em’. I wear a really thin pair of glove liners under them because it feels good, warm and will help regulate moisture. The mitt is soft, supple and the Velcro perfect. It fits well, they look svelte and the price is right. I bought a second pair so I can wear a pair ski touring on the ascents and a nice dry pair for the ride down or emergencies. As far as durability goes… I expect they’ll last a few seasons if you’re thoughtful with your gear. If you don’t give a crap about your gear, work in mitts,  and ski or board everyday… you could burn through a pair in a season. I love these and now I’m a mitt guy. I chose an XL because I have long fingers and I like to wear the thin liner. No complaints here… just warm, dry paws.
review.name: I was a glove guy…

review.reviewBody: Purchased these mittens on Dec. 17th 2022 received them around the 20th. I initially thought they were awesome. Good fit, warm, comfy. After 4 days at the mountain I realized the a couple holes in the goat skin on the palms/finger of both mittens. I reached out and they had me send photos to the warranty department on Jan. 10th 2023, and have had radio silence since. Sent a second email yesterday still nothing. I don’t expect something like a pair of gloves/mittens to last more than a season or 2. But four days at the mtn is kinda lame.
review.name: Lasted about a week

review.reviewBody: These gloves work great. Super warm and keep my hands dry. They are fantastic for colder days on the hill.
review.name: Great for the price

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite mittens and I’ve owned a ton. They are warm but don’t have too much insulation. They feel broken in when you first put them on. They have great straps to help make sure you don’t lose them on the lift. These are a great deal.
review.name: These are great

name: GORE-TEX Snow Mitten

review.reviewBody:
Nice design, and suitable for my face shape.also very Stylish, comfortable, and affordable - 4 stars!

description: Buy the Mountain House Buffalo Style Chicken Mac + Cheese online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Buffalo Style Chicken Mac + Cheese
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Buffalo Style Chicken Mac + Cheese online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
If you like hot and spicy, this is for you. But way too much heat for me.  Also, the noodles were not hydrated and crunchy, and the cheese still powdery. 
 However, I put the remainder into a small wide brim hot food Thermos for 5 hours and it all softened up, and was a good consistency. Very important to really stir well before and after.  This was my first MH meal, so I truly hope the others in the tub are better than this.  I based my purchase on 5 star reviews.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I thought the meal was really good, defiantly buffalo chicken. Great meal to change up flavors on a multi day hike. Great quality. I put my meals in an insulated cozy while I set up camp, they rehydrate for probably 25 minutes.
review.name: Amazing, a Backpackers Dream!

review.reviewBody: I just got my chicken mac & cheese let me tell you i was shocked how good this was creamy just the right amount of spices.my goodness ordering more as i speak love love so good. ty for this wonderful product
review.name: Smack my lips

review.reviewBody: I brought the Buffalo Mac and cheese on my first overlanding trip and this was the perfect meal! It was quick, creamy, and hit the spot after riding around all day.
review.name: Quick, creamy, and hits the spot

review.reviewBody: We do a lot of northern Maine camping and hunting ! It’s quick ,lightweight & very tasty!
review.name: Like it

review.reviewBody: I buy 10 or so entries every payday. Keep a few in my car and wife’s at all times, never know when you’ll need it. Great price, shelf life and taste. It’s a win all the way around!
review.name: Keep some in car at all times

review.reviewBody: Another great meal from MH! Prefect Buffalo taste, just the right heat! I use these meals as a supplement to local meals. Traveling the world it is comfortable to know I have these meals as a solid backup!
review.name: Great taste another winner!

review.reviewBody: One of our favs... cheesy and Buffalo-y.  We order mountian house all of the time.  We adventure all over the world and this is the best meal your going to get in the middle of nowhere.
review.name: One of the best they offer!

review.reviewBody:
I personally like the chili mac meal better it has more spice and flavor.
This one is a little more mild which I am sure some people prefer
review.name: AA good option but has some room for improvement

review.reviewBody: This meal is by far one of the best I've had backpacking.  Can't wait to buy more!
review.name: Most delicious meal of my trip

name: Buffalo Style Chicken Mac + Cheese
