hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Road Drive Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love the flexible hose attachment so that there's less worry about damaging the tube at the valve stem while you're trying to get back on the road quickly.
review.name: Nice design

review.reviewBody:
Got one of these in the Large 12" size, figuring the small additional weight was worth it for faster pumping.  To make sure I pump up enough to avoid a pinch flat, I wanted a pressure gauge, so I replaced the hose with an ABS Pen Gauge, available here.  Pricey, but I mitigated the cost by having just one pump, switching it between my winter and summer bikes as needed.  Lezyne sells pumps with digital gauges, but the battery might go dead between uses and the accuracy of the mechanical gauge is adequate for me. [The ABS Pen Gauge product description here says it lacks a vent button, which is incorrect.  My pen gauge has one, and it's visible in the picture in the product listing]

Don't like putting something so long and hard in my jersey pockets, so I got bottle cages with pump "holsters" molded into the side  Lezyne sells two: Flow Cage HP for the budget-minded and Road Drive Cage Carbon for the weight-minded.  Both work well, I have one of each between my two bikes.  They are sized for the diameter of Road Drive pumps.

Thankfully, not many flats lately so haven't needed to use it much.
review.name: Part of a larger "pump solution"

review.reviewBody: I just purchased this pump and have tested it to pump up my tires. I bought it specifically for its flexible hose apparatus after nearly breaking a valve stem using a hand pump that didn't have a hose. So far I like it; good delivery of air for a hand pump and with the hose I don't have to worry about twisting or breaking a valve stem as is the case with other hand pumps.  I do advise reading Joe's comment from June 2015 about how to properly use the pump so that it doens't damage the valve stem. I bought the largest one, which is 12" in length. Fits in a back jersey pocket, though sticks out a bit and is too long for most top-tube bags. Might want to consider a medium to avoid these two issues though will have a bit less air delivery.
review.name: Good pump, so far

name: Road Drive Pump

review.reviewBody: Snappy, fast and easy to install. Sometimes the culprit to poor dropper performance isn't even the dropper. I've upgraded almost all my levers and the difference is notable.
review.name: Best upgrade you can make to a bike

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace my OEM Bike Yoke lever, which had high resistance. The PNW effectively increased the leverage, making for easier activation. The rubber pad is nice, too.

review.reviewBody: I didn't think PNW could improve upon the Loam Lever but they have. This updated lever has more range than before which allows even the pickiest riders to dial in their cockpit. The padding on the lever feels great with or without gloves and offers plenty of grip so you never miss an actuation. Simply put, you won't find a better lever on the market.

hasVariant.name: Bottle Pocket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Bottle Pocket online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got this and put it on the left side of my hip belt, with a forager box on the ruger side. The forager box is a huge easy to open & close (even with gloves on) hip belt storage. And this water bottle keeps a Nalgene bottle right by my hand - no more contorting my arm to try to reach my water bottle or having to take my pack off to put it back.
review.name: Finally! Easy to reach water bottle location

review.reviewBody: Can't speak to longevity yet, but held onto a 32oz Nalgene no issue for an 11 day elk hunt. Used everyday/all day.
review.name: Simple

review.reviewBody: Was skeptical about buying this since I wasn’t sure if it would fit a 48 oz Nalgene bottle. Works perfect and fits well makes taking a drink of water without taking your pack off easy. Another durable and great product from mystery ranch.
review.name: It works well with the MOLLE system.

review.reviewBody: I own a lot of mystery ranch gear and love it! BUT, very Disappointed in the attachment system in this. I wish it had a similar mole webbing attachment as bear spray or other accessories. It has constantly fallen off, which makes me not want to use it at all. Unless they update the attachment, I would NOT recommend.
review.name: So close, yet so far -- Attachment system fails

review.reviewBody: I’ve long struggled with finding the right place to put my water bottle when carrying my pack, and finally invested in this bottle pocket. This has allowed me to easily reach my water bottle and keep it close and hands free when I’m not drinking out of it. I use to keep it in my pack side pocket, but no longer have to awkwardly reach back to find it, and can now use the side pocket for additional gear storage. So worth it! I would recommend a lightweight Nalgene for the bottle pocket, as anything heavier could be quite cumbersome.
review.name: What I needed!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my beartooth 80 and it fits perfectly on the waistband. The bungee that goes around the top of the Nalgene is really nice and makes the bottle feel extra secure.
review.name: Perfect for a Nalgene

review.reviewBody: Great piece of gear, very well made. I highly recommend these water bottle pockets over all the other competitors.
review.name: Awesome!!

review.reviewBody: Great option for carrying Nalgene bottles. Lightweight and easy to access with one hand. the only reason I didn't give it 5-stars is I would like it to be available in Coyote.
review.name: Light and effective

review.reviewBody:
Added this to my mystery ranch pack webbing.
Great addition , light and easy to attach
review.name: Great pack addition

review.reviewBody: I bought this to go on my MR Guide Light MT Frame. It works great, however, as I often take my pack off and put it back on as well as toss it in the back of my truck and pull it out, the tuck tabs are constantly coming untucked and then the bottle holder is not secured and i have to retuck the tabs. I'd say if you aren't rough with your pack or don't get accessories snagged on stuff too often this is probably fine, however, for those with more rough movement, you may want to look elsewhere or try modifying this to a snap.
review.name: Not a fan of the tuck tabs

name: Bottle Pocket
Bottle Pocket

Buy the Yakima HoldUp Bike Rack - 2in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: HoldUp Bike Rack - 2in
hasVariant.description: Buy the Yakima HoldUp Bike Rack - 2in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: First time with a trailer hitch-mounted rack. Came recommended by a buddy who’s had this model for years particularly because of its ability to expand to carry four bikes once our kids’ bikes no longer fit in the car. Install was easy. Only ding I’d give it is that the release tab can be awkward to reach when bikes are loaded (if you’ve lowered the rack to open/close your tailgate)…other brands have step pedal that’s more accessible, but also cost $200+ more. So far happy with this rack and look forward to lots more use.
review.name: Solid family bike rack

review.reviewBody: This rack is perfect for me because I only carry one bike in the back of my pick up truck. It’s rock solid and does the and easy to use. Works well on backcountry roads.
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: I ordered the rack from here because of a 15% off deal. It disappeared in transit for four days somewhere between NC and OH, which I am sure is the fault of FedEx. When the rack arrived there were two broken parts, also probably the fault of FedEx. Also, the anti-rattle hitch bolt assembly was installed upside down, not the fault of FedEx. I am now responsible to hunt down the replacement parts form Yakima because it apparently not the responsibility of the store that sold it to me.
review.name: Rack finally arrived with broken parts.

review.reviewBody:
I've owned this rack for about 9 years. It's broken twice--the arms develop a wobble and get loose. The first time Yakima warrantied/replaced the arms after my LBS said they proactively sent out new arms. The second time, Yakima won't warranty them over the fact that I don't have my receipt. Moreover, they've been condescending about it my not having a receipt (which is odd because they don't have a record of sending my LBS new arms). 

Anyway, it's a rack. It develops a wobble so bad the arms will fall down in the folded down position and drag on the road. Also Yakima won't stand behind their product. 

Beyond those issues, it's not great for modern 29" mountain bikes--even with 2.35 tires.
review.name: Broken 2X in less than 10 Years

review.reviewBody: Excellent rack. Easy to assemble,  holds bikes securely, easy to put on vehicle.
review.name: Great rack

review.reviewBody: Love it! Easy to install and is quiet, (no rattling). Works great for all bikes. Keeps my bikes safe and secure.
review.name: Great Rack

name: HoldUp Bike Rack - 2in

review.reviewBody: I wear these pants all the time one of the best buys I've had from Backcountry
review.name: Holy shnikee SOOO comfortable

review.reviewBody: I recently bought this for winter. Its super war, super comfy and I love the knee and butt covers to block wind. I prayed the cover with Scotchgard to keep my butt and knees from getting wet while camping. I did order it a little large, but a little cutting and snipping under the belt fixed that. Overall, very happy with it. In fact, Im wearing them right now on a very cold Colorado morning and staying very cozy.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’11” and weigh 175 pounds, I found the medium size to be a perfect fit. These pants are incredibly warm and cozy. I’m planning to wear them around camp or as insulation under snow pants on really cold ski days. The rip stop fabric makes layering these really easy as everything slips right over these pants. It also looks cool too.
review.name: Warm and Cozy!

description: Buy the Camp Chef Camp Table online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp Table
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Camp Table online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Camp Table is a great back saver for this old camp cook. Very well built and sturdy.
review.name: Camp Chef Camp Table gets the job done!

review.reviewBody:
I used this a couple of times for Dutch oven cooking, worked great.  

Now, I am using it for my propane forge and it is working even better.  I don't have to worry about forge heat and I have room for the end cap bricks.  I can even place hot steel on it for cooling.
review.name: Great Table

review.reviewBody: I bought this table after a coffee pot slid off my plastic table.
review.name: Love this table

review.reviewBody: I was surprised at the heavy-duty construction of this table. The wind shield is rigid and should last, the legs are sturdy and should be a very stable base for our two Dutch ovens we use on a daily basis when camping or out back when home. I added slip on rubber ends for the base of the legs to make cleanup easier after camping use. Now we just need spring to get here so we can go camping! Great product. You need to make a carry bag for easier transporting. Leg and shield bag are great but a large bag to put the whole unit in would make it a perfect purchase.
review.name: Versatile, heavy-duty table

review.reviewBody: Great for charcoal cooking with camp ovens. Great.
review.name: Camp Table for charcoal cooking.

review.reviewBody: Very sturdy. Worked great for my Japanese Konro grill and firing up charcoal. Only wish there was a better way to store it as it comes with a bag for the legs. Windscreen is ok.
review.name: Camp Table with 32” Legs

review.reviewBody: Great platform for a portable grill or multiple Dutch ovens. Well built, easy to assemble and very sturdy. A must for anyone that does any outdoor cooking.
review.name: Sturdy Built

review.reviewBody: The Camp Table is one of the best investments I ever made for my outdoor cooking hobby.  Makes Dutch Oven cooking SOOO much easier and much-more manageable and much-more enjoyable – I don’t know what I’d do without it!
review.name: 10 Stars!

review.reviewBody:
I was using a small plate with short unstable legs and finally decided to buy this table. It met my expectations and some. Very stable on the grass and plenty of room on the table. No issues with warping and no issues with clean up. I like the handles on the side to hang my toung's and my lid lifter. It fits 2 charcoal chimneys, my 14" and 12" dutch oven just fine. And with a bad back it is lite enough I can load it and unload out of my truck with no worries. I am 6'1" and it is the perfect hight making the ovens very accessible without bending over. I will get something to store it in like the bag for my Camp Chef cooker to make it easier to keep everything together. 
 I highly recommend this table.
review.name: Met my expectations

review.reviewBody: I bought two burner camp stove and a camp table. Both are good products, work as advertised. Table assembly is easy. Stove fits on the table well, with some spare space left over to keep other things.
review.name: Camp Table and Camp stove

name: Camp Table

description: Buy the Thule Overcast Awning online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Overcast Awning
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Overcast Awning online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Easy to set up and take down. Overcast awning is a solid purchase.
review.name: overcast awning

review.reviewBody: Best invention ever! Very well constructed, easy to set up and stow.  Stable and secure.  I absolutely love it and highly recommend it.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: I'm in my first season using the OverCast awning but so far I am very happy with it.  It was easy to install on the rack, can be setup with one person with some practice & skill, or two people very quickly. It is well made and provides a great benefit to my Honda Element when camping or tailgating.  I would have given it a five star rating but the lack of a side shade option was disappointing.
review.name: Nice Addition w/ Minimum Effort.  No Side Shade?

review.reviewBody: Installation and set up of this awning is incredibly simple and satisfying! The awning looks great and creates a large shaded space. I highly recommend for car roof racks or rvs.
review.name: OverCast 6.5 ft

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight, easy to install/open up with 2 people and only took up a few inches of the Thule rack next to a rooftop tent. We specifically bought this for shade while camping in the desert, but we experienced rain on our first trip out and it held up great adjusted at an angle for runoff. Shipping was surprisingly fast too!
review.name: Perfect addition to our weekend getaway car!

review.reviewBody:
It was easy to assemble and put on our wingbar crossbars.
Set it up at the campsite is easy and can be done by 1 person, but is way easier with a helping hand. 
It covers enough space and seem to be pretty high quality.  We are very happy with it!
review.name: Great awning for the 4runner

review.reviewBody: I was worried about the process of mounting it up the roof rack and using the supplied hardware but in regular Thule style, it can with everything needed and was installed without trouble.
review.name: A nice awning with solid hardware

review.reviewBody: Great quality, easy to install and works as advertised!
review.name: Thule Overcast 6.5 review

name: Overcast Awning

review.reviewBody: These are my first Ocun crack gloves. I had a different, thinner, brand before. First off, make sure to measure your hand for fit. I had worn XS in the other brand but wear M in the Ocun. These gloves have a very strong velcro attachment and a system to tuck the strap in which should keep it from unhooking. This is great but may require you to get your partner to help do the tucking. The rubber on the gloves is sticky and the hand is well protected. They should be good for training in the gym and for gnarly cracks outdoors.
review.name: Ocun crack gloves

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been warning this coat (Detroit) since 1973. It was my go to for working outside. It's not same as in the past but I glad to have another one
review.name: I would buy it again

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Size M 
This jacket is not made for work. The shoulder and arms are "re-engineered" and are much worse fitting than the original jacket. The arms are tight and don't allow much movement, the sleeves are almost humorously long with giant cuffs at the end that aren't practical to roll up and are generally uncomfortable.
I went out on a limb buying this because of the new color and have tried hard to like the jacket given the price, but it is one of my least favorite products I have ordered from this company. 
For an around the town or standing still jacket it's fine, still awkward in the fit? but for any amount of ranch work or labor, you will be uncomfortable, and constantly bothered by this jacket.
review.name: Less than ideal, not a work jacket.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket, great color, and great for layering.
review.name: Detroit Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like it, thought it would be a bit warmer even with the 1warm rating. Not sure of the durability rating below bc I've only had it a couple weeks. Time will tell but so far so good.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket!! Hands down the most versatile piece of clothing I have.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: It's definitely a light weight version of the Detroit jacket, easy to move around in but still looking great, the trouble I had with mine was one of the stitch lines going down the left sleeve wasn't done right. The stitch came undone in a week of casual wear, I did call and got it replaced so hopefully it was just a one off. Apart from that great jacket
review.name: Looks great, but mine had some initial issues.

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the jacket. But would like it in carharrt brown instead. I haven't removed any of the tags and still have the receipt. How can I do that?

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit Duck Detroit Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Jacket is true to size with good room around the shoulders for free movement and layering. It seems to be a well made light jacket and will be my new go to jacket. I wish they made this exact jacket in sand dune with lined sleeves and insulation for winter.
review.name: Great all season jacket.

review.reviewBody: I bought the jacket because my 12-year-old son wanted a reversable jacket. He is smaller than me, and I am a 5'1" woman who wears women XS. review.reviewBody: This will be my second 1/2 zip because I think it’s absolutely stellar.  I’ve used it hiking and skiing in colder weather.  I really enjoy how it feels in my skin, soft but warm.  A large breast pocket to store your phone… a big phone for that matter.  This too shines in cold, blustery weather.  I’ve been it multiple days skiing in 20 degree weather with wind chill.  I love it so much that I purchased two for my partner during the friends and family event.  Outdoor Research is my go to for all seasons.  You just purchase one for yourself, you won’t regret itit.
review.name: Deviator 1/2 Zip Is A Must!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this product to replace an old, thick, heavy fleece prior to a backpacking trip. I cannot believe how warm the Deviator is, while remaining super light and thin. I wear it for multiple purposes - as a regular shirt, for exercise, or as an outer layer. My phone (and case) actually fit inside the chest pocket, and I always appreciate having thumbholes. I'm a slim 5'6" and the Small fits true to size. My partner liked it so much that he's getting one too!
review.name: Incredibly warm, lightweight, and versatile fleece

name: Deviator Fleece 1/2-Zip Pullover - Women's
